1.1.1.1.name: If (Boolean Logic)
1.1.1.1.description: Evaluates True/False conditions to route data.

1.1.1.2.name: Switch (Multi-path)
1.1.1.2.description: Routes data to multiple paths based on value matching.

1.1.1.3.name: Merge (Join Streams)
1.1.1.3.description: Merges data streams from multiple branches.

1.1.2.1.name: Split In Batches (Loop)
1.1.2.1.description: Splits data into batches to create loops.

1.1.2.2.name: Wait (Time/Webhook)
1.1.2.2.description: Pauses the workflow until a specific time or signal.

1.1.2.3.name: NoOp (Pass-through)
1.1.2.3.description: No operation node, used for comments or alignment.

1.1.2.4.name: Stop and Error
1.1.2.4.description: Forces the workflow to stop and reports an error.

1.1.3.2.name: Workflow Trigger (Sub-workflow Receiver)
1.1.3.2.description: Serves as the starting point for a sub-workflow.

1.1.3.3.name: Workflow Tools (AI/LangChain)
1.1.3.3.description: Allows AI Agents to call workflows or use workflows as data retrievers.

1.2.1.2.name: Item Lists
1.2.1.2.description: Handles sorting, aggregation, and deduplication of arrays.

1.2.2.1.name: Code (JS/Python)
1.2.2.1.description: Executes custom code for complex calculations.

1.2.4.1.name: Spreadsheet File
1.2.4.1.description: Reads and writes Excel/CSV file content.

1.2.4.2.name: Format Parsers
1.2.4.2.description: Parses XML, HTML, and Markdown formats.

1.3.1.3.name: Feeds & Server Protocol
1.3.1.3.description: Handles RSS Feeds, Server-Sent Events, and MCP Servers.

1.3.3.1.name: AMQP & MQTT
1.3.3.1.description: Messaging queue protocols: AMQP, MQTT, RabbitMQ, Redis, Kafka.

1.4.1.1.name: Schedule / Cron
1.4.1.1.description: Triggers workflows at scheduled times or intervals.

1.4.1.2.name: Interval
1.4.1.2.description: Triggers cyclically at fixed second intervals.

1.4.2.2.name: Chat Triggers
1.4.2.2.description: Triggers for AI chat interfaces and manual chats.

1.4.2.4.name: System & Error
1.4.2.4.description: Triggers on workflow errors or n8n system events.

1.4.3.1.name: Manual / Start
1.4.3.1.description: Manual click trigger or default starting point.

1.4.3.2.name: Evaluation / Simulation
1.4.3.2.description: Triggers for dataset evaluation or simulation.

1.5.1.1.name: Office & File Management
1.5.1.1.description: Triggers for Google/Microsoft/Box calendar, drive, sheets, or email.

1.5.1.2.name: Project & Task Management
1.5.1.2.description: Triggers for project and task management tools (including Flow).

1.5.1.3.name: Scheduling & Time Tracking
1.5.1.3.description: Triggers for appointment scheduling and time tracking.

1.5.1.4.name: Communication Triggers
1.5.1.4.description: Triggers for instant messaging and push notifications.

1.5.2.3.name: DevOps, Security & Design
1.5.2.3.description: Triggers for security, design, and community development tools.

1.5.3.1.name: Forms & Surveys
1.5.3.1.description: Triggers on form submissions and surveys.

1.5.3.2.name: CRM & Support
1.5.3.2.description: Triggers for CRM updates and support tickets.

1.5.3.3.name: Email Marketing
1.5.3.3.description: Triggers for marketing emails and automation flows.

1.5.3.4.name: Commerce, Payment & Social
1.5.3.4.description: Triggers for e-commerce, payments, Webflow, and social marketing.

1.5.3.5.name: Logistics & HR
1.5.3.5.description: Triggers for logistics delivery and HR recruiting.

1.5.3.6.name: Other Personal
1.5.3.6.description: Triggers for personal fitness tracking and other utilities.

2.1.1.1.name: AI Agent & Agent Tool
2.1.1.1.description: Autonomous agents that generate action plans and execute them using tools.

2.1.2.1.name: Basic Chains
2.1.2.1.description: Linear sequences for basic prompting or text summarization.

2.1.2.2.name: QA & Retrieval Chains
2.1.2.2.description: Chains specialized in answering questions based on retrieved documents (Question and Answer Chain).

2.1.3.1.name: Chat Response
2.1.3.1.description: Sends a response back to the chat interface.

2.2.1.1.name: Proprietary Models
2.2.1.1.description: Hosted chat models from major providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, AWS, etc.).

2.2.1.2.name: Open Source / Self-Hosted Models
2.2.1.2.description: Models run locally (Ollama) or via inference APIs (DeepSeek, Hugging Face).

2.2.1.3.name: Model Gateways
2.2.1.3.description: Routers and gateways to access multiple underlying models.

2.2.3.1.name: Text Embeddings
2.2.3.1.description: Models that convert text into vector representations for RAG.

2.2.4.1.name: Provider APIs
2.2.4.1.description: Direct interaction with provider APIs for tasks beyond simple chat (e.g., Assistants API, file management).

2.3.1.1.name: Cloud Vector Databases
2.3.1.1.description: Connectors to external vector database services (Insert, Load, and Query).

2.3.1.2.name: Self-Hosted / In-Memory
2.3.1.2.description: Local or Postgres-based vector storage solutions.

2.3.2.1.name: Retrievers
2.3.2.1.description: Logic for querying vector stores and ranking results.

2.3.3.1.name: Document Loaders
2.3.3.1.description: Ingest data from files, JSON, or repositories into the chain.

2.3.3.2.name: Text Splitters
2.3.3.2.description: Break down large documents into manageable chunks for embeddings.

2.4.1.1.name: Information Lookup
2.4.1.1.description: Tools for retrieving external knowledge (Wikipedia, Search) or computation.

2.4.2.1.name: Custom Functionality
2.4.2.1.description: Custom logic, HTTP requests, thinking (CoT), or vector QA packaged as tools.

2.4.3.1.name: App Actions as Tools
2.4.3.1.description: Specific application actions wrapped for use by AI agents (e.g., Google Chat, MCP).

2.4.4.1.name: Standard Nodes (Non-Tool)
2.4.4.1.description: Standard n8n nodes for these services (included here as they appear in the AI data context) and LangChain Code.

2.5.1.1.name: Storage Backends
2.5.1.1.description: Storage backends for maintaining conversation history (Simple Memory, Redis, Postgres, etc.).

2.5.2.1.name: Managers & Retrievers
2.5.2.1.description: Utilities to retrieve and manage context window.

2.6.1.1.name: Format Enforcers
2.6.1.1.description: Ensures LLM output adheres to specific JSON schemas or list formats.

2.6.2.1.name: NLP Utilities
2.6.2.1.description: Specialized nodes for classifying or extracting data from text.

3.1.1.1.name: SQL Databases
3.1.1.1.description: Store and query structured data using SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake).

3.1.2.1.name: NoSQL Databases
3.1.2.1.description: Manage unstructured or semi-structured data (documents, collections).

3.1.3.1.name: Realtime & Key-Value Stores
3.1.3.1.description: High-performance data storage for caching and realtime syncing.

3.1.4.1.name: Search Engines
3.1.4.1.description: Index, search, and analyze large volumes of data.

3.2.1.1.name: Cloud Object Storage
3.2.1.1.description: Store and retrieve files/objects in the cloud (S3, GCS, Azure Blob).

3.2.2.1.name: FTP & SSH
3.2.2.1.description: Transfer files and execute commands on remote servers.

3.3.1.1.name: Git & Repositories
3.3.1.1.description: Manage code versioning, issues, and CI/CD pipelines.

3.3.2.1.name: Identity & Infrastructure
3.3.2.1.description: Manage user identities, SSL certificates, and load balancers.

3.4.2.1.name: Pub/Sub
3.4.2.1.description: Publish and subscribe to event streams.

3.5.1.1.name: NLP Services
3.5.1.1.description: Analyze text for sentiment, entities, and language.

3.5.2.1.name: Vision & OCR
3.5.2.1.description: Analyze images and extract text from documents.

3.6.1.1.name: GraphQL
3.6.1.1.description: Query APIs using the GraphQL query language.

4.1.1.1.name: Comprehensive CRM
4.1.1.1.description: Manage customer relationships, sales pipelines, and marketing automation.

4.1.2.1.name: Accounting & Payments
4.1.2.1.description: Handle invoicing, payments, and enterprise resource planning.

4.2.1.1.name: Email Campaigns
4.2.1.1.description: Manage email lists and send marketing campaigns.

4.2.2.1.name: Social Networks
4.2.2.1.description: Publish content and interact on social media platforms.

4.2.3.1.name: CMS & Video
4.2.3.1.description: Manage website content and video publishing.

4.2.3.2.name: Web Analytics
4.2.3.2.description: Track website traffic and user behavior.

4.3.1.1.name: Online Stores
4.3.1.1.description: Manage products, orders, and customers for online stores.

4.4.1.1.name: Messaging & VoIP
4.4.1.1.description: Handle SMS, voice calls, and team messaging.

4.4.2.1.name: File Management
4.4.2.1.description: Store and manage files in the cloud.

4.5.1.1.name: Data Handling
4.5.1.1.description: Process Excel, XML, HTML, and binary files.

4.5.2.1.name: System Operations
4.5.2.1.description: Execute system commands and manage security/infrastructure.

5.1.1.1.name: Team Chat
5.1.1.1.description: Integration with chat platforms for messaging, channel management, and bot interactions.

5.1.2.1.name: Personal & Business Email
5.1.2.1.description: Sending, receiving, and organizing emails, drafts, and attachments.

5.1.3.1.name: Meetings & Webinars
5.1.3.1.description: Management of meetings, webinars, and registrants.

5.2.1.1.name: Agile & Project Boards
5.2.1.1.description: Comprehensive tools for managing projects, boards, issues, and sprints (including Jira Software).

5.2.2.1.name: Task Lists
5.2.2.1.description: Lightweight task management for personal or simple team checklists.

5.2.3.1.name: Workspace Knowledge
5.2.3.1.description: Managing structured content, wikis, and databases within documentation platforms.

5.3.1.1.name: Enterprise Storage
5.3.1.1.description: Operations for uploading, downloading, organizing, and converting files in cloud storage.

5.3.2.1.name: Structured Data Sheets
5.3.2.1.description: Reading and writing structured data in spreadsheets, CSVs, and low-code databases.

5.3.3.1.name: Documents & Presentations
5.3.3.1.description: Automating the creation and editing of text documents and presentations.

5.3.4.1.name: Calendar Management
5.3.4.1.description: Managing events, availability, and calendar file generation.

5.4.1.1.name: Business Contacts
5.4.1.1.description: Managing customer relationships, accounts, and contact directories.

5.4.2.1.name: Ads & Listings
5.4.2.1.description: Managing advertising campaigns and online business listings.

5.4.3.1.name: Enterprise Data Warehouse
5.4.3.1.description: Enterprise-grade database operations and data warehousing queries.

5.5.1.1.name: Organization Admin
5.5.1.1.description: Administration of users, groups, and organizational units (Google Workspace Admin, Entra ID).

5.5.2.1.description: Monitoring security alerts and scores within the Microsoft ecosystem.

5.5.3.1.description: APIs for translation, content moderation (toxicity analysis), and book data.

6.1.1.1.description: Filter, sort, aggregate, restructure, and compare JSON/binary data.

6.1.1.2.description: Convert between HTML, Markdown, PDF, CSV, and other formats.

6.1.1.3.description: Extract structured data from documents using AI/OCR.

6.1.2.1.description: Read, write, compress, and edit files on the local system.

6.1.3.1.description: Encryption, hashing, JWT signing, and TOTP generation.

6.2.3.1.description: Send push notifications and operational alerts.

6.2.4.1.description: Integration with various chat and support platforms.

6.3.1.1.description: Manage build pipelines, cloud deployment, and package registries.

6.3.2.1.description: Monitor system health, logs, uptime, and business intelligence.

6.3.2.2.description: Manage identity, secrets, certificates, and threat intelligence.

6.3.3.1.name: Low-Code & Time-Series DB
6.3.3.1.description: Connect to low-code (Baserow, NocoDB), time-series (CrateDB), and app databases.

6.4.1.1.description: Automate marketing campaigns and customer engagement.

6.4.1.2.description: Enrich leads and manage sales intelligence.

6.4.3.1.name: Content & Apps
6.4.3.1.description: Manage content, e-commerce, and no-code applications.

6.5.1.1.description: Utilities for URL shortening, translation, weather, web scraping, and market data.
